name: Sattu Paratha
history: Sattu Paratha is a popular dish in Bihar, India. Sattu, made from roasted gram flour, is a nutritious ingredient and a staple in Bihari cuisine.
description: Sattu Paratha is a stuffed flatbread filled with a spicy sattu (roasted gram flour) mixture. It is often flavored with garlic, ginger, green chilies, and herbs, making it a hearty and flavorful meal.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: For preparing the dough and filling.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Mix whole wheat flour with water to form a soft dough. Set aside to rest.

instructions.title: Make the Filling
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix sattu, onions, green chilies, ginger, garlic, coriander leaves, carom seeds, and salt.

instructions.title: Stuff and Roll the Parathas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into balls. Roll each ball, place a portion of the sattu filling in the center, seal, and roll again to flatten.

instructions.title: Cook the Parathas
instructions.description: Heat a tawa or skillet. Cook each paratha with oil or ghee until golden brown on both sides.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Sattu Parathas hot with yogurt, pickle, or chutney.

tips: The filling should be dry to prevent the parathas from breaking while rolling.
Cook on a medium flame for even cooking and to prevent burning.
variations: Add finely chopped spinach or paneer to the filling for a nutritious twist.
Spice up the filling with different herbs or spices according to taste.

storage.shelfLife: Sattu Parathas can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a tawa before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a tawa or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Cut the parathas into triangles and serve on a plate with a side of colorful chutneys.
